subject: Politics
title: What Is Federalism
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Is Federalism.

hook.text: In America, marijuana is legal in some states and illegal in others. That's federalism at work.

buildup.text: Federalism divides power between central government and regional governments like states or provinces.

discovery.text: Each level has its own authority. States handle education and police. The federal level handles defense.

twist.text: Federalism can protect liberty by preventing power concentration. But it also shelters local injustice.

climax.text: The US, Germany, India, and Brazil use federal systems. Each balances central and regional power.

punchline.text: Federalism splits power by geography. One country, many rule books.

quiz.question: What does federalism divide?
options: Power between central and regional governments
Power between the military and civilians
Power between rich and poor citizens
